section.title: Configuring the Database for Compute
section.para: Create the tables in your backend data store by running the following command:
If you see any response, you can look in /var/log/nova/nova-manage.log to see the problem. No response means the command completed correctly and your nova database is now populated.
On both nodes, restart all services in total, just to cover the entire spectrum:

para.literallayout: sudo service nova-api restart sudo service nova-compute restart sudo service nova-network restart sudo service nova-scheduler restart sudo service nova-vncproxy restart sudo service libvirt-bin restart sudo /etc/init.d/rabbitmq-server restart

section.para: All nova services are now installed and started. If the "restart" command doesn't work, your services may not be running correctly (or not at all). Review the logs in /var/log/nova.
